name: Creamy Mexican-Inspired Tomato Soup
description: A quick, plant-based, protein-packed tomato soup with fresh Mexican-inspired flavours! Delicious paired with grilled cheese.

ingredients.name: unsalted butter, navy, or white kidney beans

preparation:
1. In large Multipurpose Pot, add tomatoes (including liquid), water, and seasoning. Cover; bring to a boil.
  2. Using the back of a wooden spoon, gently smash tomatoes. Drain and rinse beans; add to pot.
  3. Stir in coconut milk. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, 7–8 min to allow flavours to blend. Stir occasionally.
  4. Remove from heat. Using an immersion blender, purée.
  5. Taste: if it’s too acidic, add maple syrup, if desired.
  6. To serve, ladle into bowls and add toppings, if desired.
tips: Whole peeled canned tomatoes are the best choice for this soup—they’re more reliable in terms of flavour and quality. In a pinch, swap with crushed or diced tomatoes, but make sure to taste and season the soup as needed.
